citation.article-title: Clostridium saccharogumia sp. nov. and Lactonifactor longoviformis gen. nov., sp. nov., two novel human faecal bacteria involved in the conversion of the dietary phytoestrogen secoisolariciresinol diglucoside.

p.s: Lactonifactor (Lac.to.ni.fac’ tor. N.L. neut. n. lactonum lactone, L. masc. n. factor maker, N.L. masc. n. lactonifactor producer of lactone).
Bacteria of the genus Lactonifactor form Gram-positive rods.
They are mesophilic, strictly anaerobic, catalase and indole negative.
Spore formation and motility have not been observed.
Phylogenetically, the genus Lactonifactor is distantly related to members of the Clostridium cluster XIVa (< 94% similarity).
The type species is L. longoviformis.
